page.title: 17Profoundly Handicapped
page.content: Rainbow School was built in 1981 for profoundly handicapped children aged 2-19 who are taught by a vast input to all senses.This approach has been a major innovation for a group of society who were institutionalized. Here 8 nursery assistants, 8 teachers and Headteacher, physiotherapist, nurse, and domestic staff provide a lively and stimulating atmosphere for 30 children in the school's brightly lit and decorated rooms and corridors. The curriculum is divided into 5 main elements:socialization;Motor; Cognitive Skills;Self Care and Communication.Each child works towards objectives within environments of learning (Classroom, Water,Creative, Community, and the Electronic where the computer has a major impact.Many individual successes have been made here using parents as partners.
